questions.stem: A particle moves in a straight line with constant acceleration. If its velocity increases from 10 m/s to 20 m/s in 5 seconds, what is the distance traveled during this time?
questions.explanation: Using the equations of motion: acceleration a = (v-u)/t = (20-10)/5 = 2 m/s². Distance s = ut + ½at² = 10×5 + ½×2×25 = 50 + 25 = 75 m.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A block of mass 2 kg is placed on a rough horizontal surface with coefficient of friction 0.5. What minimum force is required to move the block?
questions.explanation: The minimum force required to move the block equals the maximum static friction: F_min = μmg = 0.5 × 2 × 10 = 10 N.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The work done in moving a charge of 2 C through a potential difference of 10 V is:
questions.explanation: Work done W = qV = 2 × 10 = 20 J.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at 30 cm from the lens. What is the object distance?
questions.explanation: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u ⇒ 1/20 = 1/30 - 1/u ⇒ 1/u = 1/30 - 1/20 = (2-3)/60 = -1/60 ⇒ u = -60 cm. The negative sign indicates object is on the same side as incident light.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The half-life of a radioactive element is 10 days. What fraction of the original sample remains after 30 days?
questions.explanation: Number of half-lives = 30/10 = 3. Fraction remaining = (1/2)^3 = 1/8.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A simple pendulum of length 1 m has a period of 2 seconds. If the length is increased to 4 m, what will be the new period?
questions.explanation: Period T ∝ √l. T₂/T₁ = √(l₂/l₁) = √(4/1) = 2. So T₂ = 2 × 2 = 4 s.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A car accelerates uniformly from rest to 20 m/s in 10 seconds. What is the distance covered?
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The resistance of a wire of length L and cross-sectional area A is R. If the length is doubled and area is halved, the new resistance will be:
questions.explanation: Resistance R = ρL/A. New resistance R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A body of mass 5 kg is moving with velocity 10 m/s. Its kinetic energy is:
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy KE = ½mv² = ½ × 5 × 100 = 250 J.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The SI unit of magnetic flux is:
questions.explanation: Magnetic flux φ = BA, so its SI unit is Weber (Wb).
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A ball is thrown vertically upward with velocity 20 m/s. The maximum height reached is:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The refractive index of water is 1.33. What is the speed of light in water?
questions.explanation: Speed in medium v = c/n = 3×10⁸/1.33 ≈ 2.25×10⁸ m/s.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The first law of thermodynamics is essentially a statement of:
questions.explanation: First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W, which represents conservation of energy.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A transformer has 100 turns in primary and 500 turns in secondary. If input voltage is 220 V, output voltage is:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The de Broglie wavelength of an electron accelerated through 100 V is approximately:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A capacitor of 10 μF is charged to 100 V. The energy stored is:
questions.explanation: Energy U = ½CV² = ½ × 10×10⁻⁶ × 10000 = 0.05 J.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The ratio of specific heats (Cp/Cv) for a diatomic gas is:
questions.explanation: For diatomic gas, degrees of freedom f = 5, so γ = 1 + 2/f = 1 + 2/5 = 1.4.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A wire carries current of 5 A. The magnetic field at 10 cm from the wire is:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The work function of a metal is 2 eV. The threshold wavelength for photoelectric emission is:
questions.explanation: λ_th = hc/φ = 1240/2 = 620 nm (using hc = 1240 eV·nm).
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A body executes SHM with amplitude 10 cm and time period 2 s. The maximum acceleration is:
questions.explanation: a_max = ω²A = (2π/T)²A = (π)² × 0.1 = 0.1π² m/s².
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The efficiency of a Carnot engine operating between 400 K and 300 K is:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A convex mirror of focal length 20 cm forms an image at 10 cm behind the mirror. The object distance is:
questions.explanation: For convex mirror: 1/f = 1/v + 1/u (v positive). 1/20 = 1/10 + 1/u ⇒ 1/u = 1/20 - 1/10 = -1/20 ⇒ u = -20 cm (object is 20 cm in front).
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The angular momentum of an electron in hydrogen atom in ground state is:
questions.explanation: For n=1, l=0, so angular momentum = √[l(l+1)]·h/2π = 0.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A particle of mass m moves in a circle of radius r with speed v. The centripetal force is:
questions.explanation: Centripetal force F = mv²/r.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The RMS speed of oxygen molecules at 27°C is:
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The impedance of a series LCR circuit at resonance is:
questions.explanation: At resonance, X_L = X_C, so impedance Z = R (minimum).
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The binding energy per nucleon is maximum for:
questions.explanation: Iron-56 has the maximum binding energy per nucleon (~8.8 MeV).
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A p-n junction diode conducts current when it is:
questions.explanation: A p-n junction diode conducts significantly only when forward biased.
questions.tip_formula: Forward bias: p-side positive, n-side negative
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: The dimensional formula of power is:
questions.explanation: Power = Work/Time = [ML²T⁻²]/[T] = ML²T⁻³.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: A body falls freely from rest. The distance covered in the first, second, and third seconds are in the ratio:
questions.explanation: Distance in nth second s_n = u + g/2(2n-1). For u=0, s_n ∝ (2n-1). So ratio: 1:3:5.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.stem: Which of the following represents the lattice structure of A₀.₉₅O containing A²⁺, A³⁺ and O²⁻ ions?
questions.explanation: Applying electrical neutrality principle: 3A²⁺ replaced by 2A³⁺ → one vacancy per pair of A³⁺. The structure is face-centered cubic.
questions.tip_formula: Charge neutrality condition: total positive charge = total negative charge
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CH(CH₃)-CHO is:
questions.explanation: The longest carbon chain containing the -CHO group has 4 carbons. The aldehyde carbon is C1, so the methyl group is at C2 → 2-Methylbutanal.
questions.tip_formula: For aldehydes, the -CHO carbon is always C1
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following has the highest boiling point?
questions.explanation: Butan-1-ol (CH₃CH₂CH₂OH) has hydrogen bonding, which gives it the highest boiling point among the given compounds.
questions.tip_formula: Boiling point: H-bonding > dipole-dipole > London forces
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The hybridization of carbon in CO₃²⁻ is:
questions.explanation: CO₃²⁻ has trigonal planar geometry with bond angle 120°, indicating sp² hybridization.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The pH of 0.01 M NaOH solution is:
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following is not a colligative property?
questions.explanation: Surface tension depends on the nature of the liquid and is not a colligative property. Colligative properties depend only on the number of solute particles.
questions.tip_formula: Colligative properties: depend on number of particles, not their identity
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of isomers possible for C₄H₈O (aldehydes and ketones) is:
questions.explanation: Aldehydes: Butanal, 2-Methylpropanal. Ketones: Butan-2-one. Total = 3 isomers.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: In the reaction: 2SO₂ + O₂ ⇌ 2SO₃, if the volume is reduced, the equilibrium:
questions.explanation: Reducing volume increases pressure. The reaction shifts in the direction with fewer moles of gas (2 moles vs 3 moles), so shifts right.
questions.tip_formula: Le Chatelier's principle: pressure change affects gas phase reactions
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The element with electronic configuration [Ar]3d⁵4s¹ is:
questions.explanation: Chromium (Z=24) has exceptional configuration [Ar]3d⁵4s¹ due to extra stability of half-filled d-subshell.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of σ and π bonds in CH₂=C=CH₂ are:
questions.explanation: Structure: H₂C=C=CH₂ has 6 C-H σ bonds, 2 C-C σ bonds, and 2 π bonds (one in each double bond). Total: 8σ, 2π.
questions.tip_formula: Single bond = 1σ, Double bond = 1σ + 1π, Triple bond = 1σ + 2π
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The rate constant of a first-order reaction is 0.693 min⁻¹. The half-life is:
questions.explanation: For first-order: t₁/₂ = 0.693/k = 0.693/0.693 = 1.0 min.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following is most acidic?
questions.explanation: o-Nitrophenol is most acidic due to -I effect and intramolecular H-bonding which stabilizes the phenoxide ion.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The coordination number in a body-centered cubic lattice is:
questions.explanation: In BCC, each atom is surrounded by 8 nearest neighbors, so coordination number = 8.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The compound that gives iodoform test is:
questions.explanation: Ethanol (CH₃CH₂OH) gives positive iodoform test as it has CH₃CH(OH)- group or can be oxidized to acetaldehyde.
questions.tip_formula: Iodoform test: CH₃CH(OH)- or CH₃CO- groups
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of moles of KMnO₄ required to oxidize 1 mole of FeC₂O₄ in acidic medium is:
questions.explanation: FeC₂O₄ → Fe³⁺ + 2CO₂ + 3e⁻ (total 3 electrons). MnO₄⁻ → Mn²⁺ (5 electrons). So moles of KMnO₄ = 3/5 = 0.6.
questions.tip_formula: n-factor of FeC₂O₄ = 3, n-factor of KMnO₄ (acidic) = 5
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The compound that does not show geometrical isomerism is:
questions.explanation: Propene (CH₃-CH=CH₂) does not show geometrical isomerism because one carbon of the double bond has two identical H atoms.
questions.tip_formula: Geometrical isomerism requires different groups on both carbons of double bond
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The standard electrode potential of hydrogen electrode is:
questions.explanation: By convention, standard hydrogen electrode (SHE) has E° = 0.00 V.
questions.tip_formula: SHE is reference electrode with E° = 0.00 V
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of water molecules in gypsum (CaSO₄·2H₂O) is:
questions.explanation: Gypsum is CaSO₄·2H₂O, so it contains 2 water molecules per formula unit.
questions.tip_formula: Gypsum: CaSO₄·2H₂O, Plaster of Paris: CaSO₄·½H₂O
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The compound used in anti-malarial drugs is:
questions.explanation: Chloroquine is used as an anti-malarial drug.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of unpaired electrons in Fe²⁺ (Z=26) is:
questions.explanation: Fe: [Ar]3d⁶4s², Fe²⁺: [Ar]3d⁶. In octahedral field, 4 unpaired electrons (high spin).
questions.tip_formula: Fe²⁺: 3d⁶, 4 unpaired electrons in high spin complex
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The reagent used in Clemmensen reduction is:
questions.explanation: Clemmensen reduction uses Zn-Hg amalgam with concentrated HCl to reduce carbonyl to methylene group.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The unit of rate constant for a zero-order reaction is:
questions.explanation: For zero-order: rate = k, so units of k = mol L⁻¹ s⁻¹.
questions.tip_formula: Zero order: mol L⁻¹ s⁻¹, First order: s⁻¹, Second order: L mol⁻¹ s⁻¹
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The compound that gives effervescence with NaHCO₃ is:
questions.explanation: Carboxylic acids like acetic acid react with NaHCO₃ to produce CO₂ gas (effervescence).
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of π electrons in benzene is:
questions.explanation: Benzene has 6 π electrons (3 double bonds × 2 electrons each).
questions.tip_formula: Aromatic compounds follow Hückel's rule: 4n+2 π electrons
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The catalyst used in Haber's process is:
questions.explanation: Haber's process for ammonia synthesis uses iron catalyst with promoters.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The geometry of XeF₄ is:
questions.explanation: XeF₄ has sp³d² hybridization with 2 lone pairs, giving square planar geometry.
questions.tip_formula: XeF₄: 6 electron pairs (4 bonding + 2 lone) → square planar
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The compound formed when calcium carbide reacts with water is:
questions.explanation: CaC₂ + 2H₂O → Ca(OH)₂ + C₂H₂ (acetylene/ethyne).
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The oxidation state of Cr in K₂Cr₂O₇ is:
questions.explanation: Let oxidation state of Cr be x. 2(+1) + 2x + 7(-2) = 0 ⇒ 2 + 2x - 14 = 0 ⇒ 2x = 12 ⇒ x = +6.
questions.tip_formula: Sum of oxidation states = charge on molecule
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of chiral centers in glucose is:
questions.explanation: Glucose has 4 chiral carbon atoms (C2, C3, C4, C5).
questions.tip_formula: Chiral center: carbon with 4 different groups
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The complex showing optical isomerism is:
questions.explanation: [Co(en)₃]³⁺ has no plane of symmetry and exists as d and l enantiomers, showing optical isomerism.
questions.tip_formula: Octahedral complexes with bidentate ligands can show optical isomerism
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: If $$f(x) = \frac{1}{1-x}$$, then $$f(f(f(x)))$$ is equal to:
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of terms in the expansion of $$(1+x)^{101}(1+x^2-x)^{100}$$ is:
questions.explanation: Maximum power = 101 + 200 = 301, minimum power = 0. But all powers from 0 to 301 are not present. The expression simplifies to $$(1+x^3)^{100}(1+x)$$, so powers are 0,1,3,4,...,301. Total terms = 202.
questions.tip_formula: Number of terms in binomial expansion
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are roots of $$x^2-6x-2=0$$ and $$a_n = \alpha^n - \beta^n$$, then $$\frac{a_{10}-2a_8}{2a_9}$$ is:
questions.explanation: From recurrence: $$\alpha^2=6\alpha+2$$, $$\beta^2=6\beta+2$$. So $$a_{n+2}=6a_{n+1}+2a_n$$. Then $$a_{10}-2a_8=6a_9+2a_8-2a_8=6a_9$$. So the expression = $$\frac{6a_9}{2a_9}=3$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The value of $$\int_0^1 \frac{x^4(1-x)^4}{1+x^2} dx$$ is:
questions.explanation: After polynomial division, the integral simplifies to $$\int_0^1 (x^6-4x^5+5x^4-4x^2+4-\frac{4}{1+x^2})dx = \frac{22}{7}-\pi$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$, then $$A^2 - 5A$$ is equal to:
questions.explanation: $$A^2 = \begin{bmatrix} 7 & 10 \\ 15 & 22 \end{bmatrix}$$, $$5A = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 10 \\ 15 & 20 \end{bmatrix}$$, so $$A^2-5A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 \end{bmatrix} = 2I$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of solutions of $$\sin x = \frac{x}{10}$$ is:
questions.explanation: The line y=x/10 intersects sine curve. For x>0, intersections at x=0 and in each period. Since maximum x/10=1 when x=10, and period is 2π≈6.28, we get intersections in (0,2π), (2π,4π), (4π,6π) and symmetric negative roots, total 7 solutions.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If the system of equations $$x+2y+3z=1$$, $$2x+3y+4z=2$$, $$3x+4y+\lambda z=3$$ has infinitely many solutions, then $$\lambda$$ equals:
questions.explanation: For infinite solutions, the determinant must be 0 and the equations must be consistent. The determinant = $$1(3\lambda-16)-2(2\lambda-12)+3(8-9)=3\lambda-16-4\lambda+24-3=-\lambda+5=0$$ ⇒ $$\lambda=5$$.
questions.tip_formula: System of linear equations - consistency condition
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The area bounded by $$y=x|x|$$, $$x=1$$, $$x=-1$$ and x-axis is:
questions.explanation: $$y=x|x| = \begin{cases} x^2 & x\geq 0 \\ -x^2 & x<0 \end{cases}$$. Area = $$\int_{-1}^0 -x^2 dx + \int_0^1 x^2 dx = \frac{1}{3}+\frac{1}{3}=\frac{2}{3}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\vec{a}$$, $$\vec{b}$$, $$\vec{c}$$ are unit vectors such that $$\vec{a}+\vec{b}+\vec{c}=\vec{0}$$, then $$\vec{a}\cdot\vec{b}+\vec{b}\cdot\vec{c}+\vec{c}\cdot\vec{a}$$ equals:
questions.explanation: Square both sides: $$|\vec{a}+\vec{b}+\vec{c}|^2=0$$ ⇒ $$3+2(\vec{a}\cdot\vec{b}+\vec{b}\cdot\vec{c}+\vec{c}\cdot\vec{a})=0$$ ⇒ the sum = $$-\frac{3}{2}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of ways to arrange the letters of the word 'ENGINEERING' is:
questions.explanation: Total letters = 11, with E-3, N-3, G-2, I-2, R-1. So arrangements = $$\frac{11!}{3!3!2!2!} = 277200$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\tan^{-1}x + \tan^{-1}y + \tan^{-1}z = \pi$$, then $$x+y+z$$ equals:
questions.explanation: Using formula: $$\tan^{-1}x+\tan^{-1}y+\tan^{-1}z = \pi$$ ⇒ $$\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{x+y+z-xyz}{1-xy-yz-zx}\right)=\pi$$ ⇒ denominator = 0 ⇒ $$1-xy-yz-zx=0$$ ⇒ $$x+y+z=xyz$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The shortest distance between the lines $$\frac{x-1}{2}=\frac{y-2}{3}=\frac{z-3}{4}$$ and $$\frac{x-2}{3}=\frac{y-4}{4}=\frac{z-5}{5}$$ is:
questions.explanation: Using formula for shortest distance between skew lines: $$d=\frac{|(\vec{a}_2-\vec{a}_1)\cdot(\vec{b}_1×\vec{b}_2)|}{|\vec{b}_1×\vec{b}_2|}$$. After calculation, we get $$d=\frac{1}{\sqrt{6}}$$.
questions.tip_formula: Shortest distance between skew lines formula
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$y = \sqrt{\sin x + \sqrt{\sin x + \sqrt{\sin x + ...}}}$$, then $$\frac{dy}{dx}$$ equals:
questions.explanation: $$y = \sqrt{\sin x + y}$$ ⇒ $$y^2 = \sin x + y$$. Differentiate: $$2y\frac{dy}{dx} = \cos x + \frac{dy}{dx}$$ ⇒ $$(2y-1)\frac{dy}{dx} = \cos x$$ ⇒ $$\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{\cos x}{2y-1}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The probability that a leap year has 53 Sundays is:
questions.explanation: Leap year has 366 days = 52 weeks + 2 days. These 2 days can be (Sun,Mon), (Mon,Tue), (Tue,Wed), (Wed,Thu), (Thu,Fri), (Fri,Sat), (Sat,Sun). Favorable cases: 2. So probability = $$\frac{2}{7}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$|z-1| = 1$$, then the value of $$\frac{z-2}{z}$$ (where $$z$$ is complex) is:
questions.explanation: Let $$z=x+iy$$. Given $$(x-1)^2+y^2=1$$. Then $$\frac{z-2}{z} = 1-\frac{2}{z} = 1-\frac{2(x-iy)}{x^2+y^2}$$. But $$x^2+y^2=2x$$ from the circle equation. So the expression becomes $$1-\frac{x-iy}{x} = -i\frac{y}{x}$$, which is purely imaginary.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of points of discontinuity of $$f(x) = [x] + [-x]$$, where [.] denotes greatest integer function, is:
questions.explanation: $$f(x) = [x] + [-x] = \begin{cases} 0 & x\in\mathbb{Z} \\ -1 & x\notin\mathbb{Z} \end{cases}$$. So discontinuous at all integers, which are infinite.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If the mean and variance of a binomial distribution are 4 and 2 respectively, then P(X≥1) is:
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The value of $$\lim_{x\to 0} \frac{\tan x - \sin x}{x^3}$$ is:
questions.explanation: $$\lim_{x\to 0} \frac{\tan x - \sin x}{x^3} = \lim_{x\to 0} \frac{\sin x(1-\cos x)}{x^3\cos x} = \lim_{x\to 0} \frac{x\cdot\frac{x^2}{2}}{x^3} = \frac{1}{2}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, then $$A^n$$ equals:
questions.explanation: By induction: $$A^2 = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, $$A^3 = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, so pattern gives $$A^n = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & n \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The equation of the normal to the parabola $$y^2=4x$$ at (1,2) is:
questions.explanation: For $$y^2=4x$$, slope of tangent at (1,2) is $$\frac{4}{2y}=1$$, so slope of normal = -1. Equation: $$y-2=-1(x-1)$$ ⇒ $$x+y-3=0$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The area of the triangle formed by the lines $$y=x$$, $$y=2x$$, and $$y=3x+4$$ is:
questions.explanation: Vertices: intersection of y=x and y=3x+4 gives (-2,-2); y=2x and y=3x+4 gives (-4,-8); origin (0,0) from y=x and y=2x. Area = $$\frac{1}{2}|x_1(y_2-y_3)+x_2(y_3-y_1)+x_3(y_1-y_2)| = \frac{1}{2}|(-2)(-8-0)+(-4)(0+2)+0| = \frac{1}{2}|16-8|=4$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\sin x + \sin y = a$$ and $$\cos x + \cos y = b$$, then $$\sin(x+y)$$ equals:
questions.explanation: Square and add: $$(\sin x+\sin y)^2+(\cos x+\cos y)^2=a^2+b^2$$ ⇒ $$2+2\cos(x-y)=a^2+b^2$$. Also, $$\sin(x+y)=\frac{2\sin\frac{x+y}{2}\cos\frac{x-y}{2}}{2\cos^2\frac{x-y}{2}}×\frac{2\cos\frac{x+y}{2}\cos\frac{x-y}{2}}{2\cos^2\frac{x-y}{2}}$$ which simplifies to $$\frac{2ab}{a^2+b^2}$$.
questions.tip_formula: Trigonometric identities for sum of angles
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of real solutions of $$x^7 + 5x^3 + 3x + 1 = 0$$ is:
questions.explanation: Let f(x)=x⁷+5x³+3x+1. f'(x)=7x⁶+15x²+3>0 for all x, so f is strictly increasing. f(-1)=-2, f(0)=1, so by IVT, there is exactly one real root.
questions.tip_formula: Using derivative to find number of real roots
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\int_0^1 e^{x^2}(x-\alpha)dx=0$$, then $$\alpha$$ equals:
questions.explanation: $$\int_0^1 e^{x^2}xdx - \alpha\int_0^1 e^{x^2}dx=0$$. Let t=x² in first integral: $$\frac{1}{2}\int_0^1 e^t dt = \frac{e-1}{2}$$. So $$\alpha = \frac{\frac{e-1}{2}}{\int_0^1 e^{x^2}dx}$$. But $$\int_0^1 e^{x^2}dx$$ cannot be simplified, so none match exactly. The correct approach gives $$\alpha = \frac{e-1}{2\int_0^1 e^{x^2}dx}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The sum of the series $$1 + \frac{1}{1+2} + \frac{1}{1+2+3} + ... + \frac{1}{1+2+...+n}$$ is:
questions.explanation: The k-th term: $$\frac{1}{1+2+...+k} = \frac{2}{k(k+1)} = 2(\frac{1}{k}-\frac{1}{k+1})$$. Sum from k=1 to n telescopes to $$2(1-\frac{1}{n+1}) = \frac{2n}{n+1}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If the circles $$x^2+y^2+2x+2ky+6=0$$ and $$x^2+y^2+2ky+k=0$$ intersect orthogonally, then k equals:
questions.explanation: For orthogonal intersection: 2g₁g₂+2f₁f₂=c₁+c₂. Here g₁=1, f₁=k, c₁=6; g₂=0, f₂=k, c₂=k. So 2(1)(0)+2(k)(k)=6+k ⇒ 2k²=6+k ⇒ 2k²-k-6=0 ⇒ (2k+3)(k-2)=0 ⇒ k=2 or k=-3/2.
questions.tip_formula: Condition for orthogonal intersection of circles
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of values of x in [0,2π] satisfying $$\sin^2 x - \cos x = \frac{1}{4}$$ is:
questions.explanation: $$\sin^2 x - \cos x = 1-\cos^2 x - \cos x = \frac{1}{4}$$ ⇒ $$4\cos^2 x+4\cos x-3=0$$ ⇒ $$(2\cos x-1)(2\cos x+3)=0$$ ⇒ $$\cos x=\frac{1}{2}$$ (since other root < -1). In [0,2π], cos x=1/2 gives x=π/3, 5π/3. So 2 solutions.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$\vec{a}$$, $$\vec{b}$$, $$\vec{c}$$ are non-coplanar vectors, then $$[\vec{a}+\vec{b} \ \vec{b}+\vec{c} \ \vec{c}+\vec{a}]$$ equals:
questions.explanation: Using scalar triple product properties: $$[\vec{a}+\vec{b}, \vec{b}+\vec{c}, \vec{c}+\vec{a}] = [\vec{a},\vec{b},\vec{c}] + [\vec{a},\vec{b},\vec{a}] + [\vec{a},\vec{c},\vec{c}] + [\vec{a},\vec{c},\vec{a}] + [\vec{b},\vec{b},\vec{c}] + [\vec{b},\vec{b},\vec{a}] + [\vec{b},\vec{c},\vec{c}] + [\vec{b},\vec{c},\vec{a}] = [\vec{a},\vec{b},\vec{c}] + [\vec{b},\vec{c},\vec{a}] = 2[\vec{a},\vec{b},\vec{c}]$$.
questions.tip_formula: Scalar triple product is zero if any two vectors are same
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The distance between the lines $$3x+4y=9$$ and $$6x+8y=15$$ is:
questions.explanation: The lines are parallel. Distance = $$\frac{|c_2-c_1|}{\sqrt{a^2+b^2}}$$. Write second line as 3x+4y=15/2. So distance = $$\frac{|\frac{15}{2}-9|}{\sqrt{9+16}} = \frac{3/2}{5} = \frac{3}{10}$$.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 \\ 0 & -2 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$6A^{-1} = A^2 + cA + dI$$, then (c,d) is:
questions.explanation: By Cayley-Hamilton theorem, A satisfies its characteristic equation. Characteristic equation: $$|A-\lambda I|=0$$ ⇒ $$(1-\lambda)[(1-\lambda)(4-\lambda)+2]=0$$ ⇒ $$\lambda^3-6\lambda^2+11\lambda-6=0$$. So $$A^3-6A^2+11A-6I=0$$ ⇒ $$A^{-1} = \frac{A^2-6A+11I}{6}$$. Comparing with given, c=-6, d=11.
questions.tip_formula: Cayley-Hamilton theorem: every matrix satisfies its characteristic equation
questions.subject: Mathematics
